Class Board

java.lang.Object
engine.Board
public class Board extends Object
Board is the main class in this chess program, responsible for tracking and updating the current board state with each played move.

Board tracks draw conditions through a constantly updated zobrist hash and half-clock counter.
It also contains the bitmasks required for valid move generation (Perhaps this should be in Move instead)
Currently the move masks are generated statically at the first instantiation of Board.
Any manipulation of the boardState or bitState is handled by methods in Board.
Additonally valid Move object creation is handled in Board, as move validity
is fundamentally linked to the current board.

Reverse Little Endian Rank-File (RLERF) encoding:

All bitmasks or bitboard representations are encoded in a RLERF format where the least significant bit
represents the 64th square (h8) and index 63 and the most significant bit represents the 1st square (a1).
Example:
     a     b      c      d      e     f      g     h
8 [56] [57] [58] [59] [60] [61] [62] [63]
7 [48] [49] [50] [51] [52] [53] [54] [55]
6 [40] [41] [42] [43] [44] [45] [46] [47]
5 [32] [33] [34] [35] [36] [37] [38] [39]
4 [24] [25] [26] [27] [28] [29] [30] [31]
3 [16] [17] [18] [19] [20] [21] [22] [23]
2 [08] [09] [10] [11] [12] [13] [14] [15]
1 [00] [01] [02] [03] [04] [05] [06] [07]

Thus the first 8 bits 0b0000 0000... would be 0b'a1''b1''c1''d1' 'e1''f1''g1''h1'

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Creates a "fresh" Board object whose state reflects that of a chess board at the start of a game.

      Generates random long values for attributes required for zobrist hashing, including the initial zobrist hash. boardState is initialized with the starting chess position, bitState is initialized similarly with full occupancy on ranks 1, 2, 7, 8

  • Method Details

    • generateWhitePawnMoveMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateWhitePawnMoveMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible white pawn moves for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid white pawn move masks for each chess square

    • generateWhitePawnAttackMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateWhitePawnAttackMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible white pawn attacks for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid white pawn attack masks for each chess square

    • generateBlackPawnMoveMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateBlackPawnMoveMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible black pawn moves for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid black pawn move masks for each chess square

    • generateBlackPawnAttackMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateBlackPawnAttackMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible black pawn attacks for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid white pawn attack masks for each chess square

    • generateKingMoveMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateKingMoveMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible king moves for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid king move masks for each chess square

    • generateKnightMoveMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateKnightMoveMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a bitmask of possible knight moves for each of the 64 chess squares.

      Indices of the returned ArrayList correspond to a "Reverse little endian rank-file" chess board encoding, where a1 = 0, a8 = 7, h8 = 63

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of valid knight move masks for each chess square

    • generateVerticalRayMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateVerticalRayMask()
      Generates 8 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a vertical raymask for each of the 8 files.

      Used to generate sliding piece moves for the Rook and Queen as their paths can be blocked by friendly or opponent pieces. Compared to move masks, these only return an Arraylist of length 8, one for each file where a = 0 -> h = 7

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of raymasks corresponding to each file

    • generateHorizontalRayMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateHorizontalRayMask()
      Generates 8 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a horizontal raymask for each of the 8 ranks.

      Used to generate sliding piece moves for the Rook and Queen as their paths can be blocked by friendly or opponent pieces. Compared to move masks, these only return an Arraylist of length 8, one for each rank where 1 = 0 -> 8 = 7

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of raymasks corresponding to each file

    • generateDiagonalRayMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateDiagonalRayMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a diagonal ray for each of the 64 board squares.

      Used to generate sliding piece moves for the Bishop and Queen as their paths can be blocked by friendly or opponent pieces.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of diagonal raymasks centered on each of the 64 squares

    • generateAntiRayMask

      public static ArrayList<Long> generateAntiRayMask()
      Generates 64 length ArrayList of Long objects, each representing a anti-diagonal ray for each of the 64 board squares.

      Used to generate sliding piece moves for the Bishop and Queen as their paths can be blocked by friendly or opponent pieces.

      Returns:
      An ArrayList of anti-diagonal raymasks centered on each of the 64 squares

    • generatePlayerPieceMask

      public long generatePlayerPieceMask(int piece)
      Generates an occupancy mask for the provided player's pieces.
      Parameters:
      piece - Can be any int just so long as the sign of the int corresponds to the player; positive for white, negative for black.
      Returns:
      Primitive long value representing occupancy mask for the specified player's pieces.

    • generateValidStraightRayMask

      public long generateValidStraightRayMask(int position)
      Generates a bitmask representing a 'blocked capture' for the Rook move pattern (Horizontal + vertical) centered on the provided position.

      Used in the generation of Queen and Rook moves. 'Blocked capture' means the mask allows the capture of the first encountered blocking piece regardless of ownership, but can move no further. Takes into account blocking piece locations on the Board object calling the method, and blocks the rays accordingly. Uses hypQuint(long,long,long) to calculate the blocked squares of the rays, and performs a bitwise OR operation to combine the vertical and horizontal ray.

      Parameters:
      position - denotes the specific square that the mask is generated for, corresponding to RLERF encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board)
      Returns:
      Primitive long value representing the 'blocked capture' straight ray mask for provided square, in RLERF encoding.

    • generateValidDiagonalRayMask

      public long generateValidDiagonalRayMask(int position)
      Generates a bitmask representing a 'blocked capture' for the Bishop move pattern (diag + anti-diag) centered on the provided position.

      Used in the generation of Queen and Bishop moves. 'Blocked capture' means the mask allows the capture of the first encountered blocking piece regardless of ownership, but can move no further. Takes into account blocking piece locations on the Board object calling the method, and blocks the rays accordingly. Uses hypQuint(long,long,long) to calculate the blocked squares of the rays, and performs a bitwise OR operation to combine the diag and anti-diag ray.

      Parameters:
      position - denotes the specific square that the mask is generated for, corresponding to RLERF encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board)
      Returns:
      Primitive long value representing the 'blocked capture' diagonal ray mask for provided square, in RLERF encoding.

    • generateValidAllRayMask

      public long generateValidAllRayMask(int position)
      Generates a bitmask representing a 'blocked capture' for the Queen move pattern (straight + diag) centered on the provided position.

      Used in the generation of Queen moves. 'Blocked capture' means the mask allows the capture of the first encountered blocking piece regardless of ownership, but can move no further. Takes into account blocking piece locations on the Board object calling the method, and blocks the rays accordingly. Uses generateValidDiagonalRayMask(int) and generateValidStraightRayMask(int) to generate bishop and rook masks, and performs a bitwise OR operation to combine all four rays (vertical, horizontal, diagonal, antidiagonal)

      Parameters:
      position - denotes the specific square that the mask is generated for, corresponding to RLERF encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board)
      Returns:
      long value representing the 'blocked capture' all ray mask for provided square, in RLERF encoding.

    • generatePieceAttackMask

      public long generatePieceAttackMask(int piece, int origin)
      Generates an attack mask representing the valid 'moves' for a given piece on a given square.

      Note: Pawn moves are handled separately in generatePawnMoveMask(int,int), and pawn attacks are generated here using generatePawnAttackMask(int,int), which handles the differing move/attack logic.

      Primary usage of this method is for both movement AND attack/captures, as both move a piece from one square to another. First the base mask corresponding with the provided piece and origin square is generated, and undergos an AND operation with an inversed friendly occupancy mask (mask & ~occ) to invalidate self-captures (alternatively mask ^ (mask & occ)). If generating the mask for a King, all king moves into opponent piece vision are invalidated (mask & ~vision).

      This method does not account for whether the moves would be legal under check, it does not invalidate self-checking moves through discovered check, and it does not provide legal castling moves for the king. These operations are done in generateValidMoves(int).

      Parameters:
      piece - primitive int representing piece value and ownership through signedness
      origin - primitive int representing the square on which the piece resides; an index refering to the bit position of the RLERF encoded bitboard representation (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      Returns:
      a primitive long value representing the bitmask of all available move destination squares, including captures on the opponent. RLERF encoded.

    • generatePawnMoveMask

      public long generatePawnMoveMask(int playerSign, int origin)
      Generates the move mask of a pawn given its origin square and ownership.

      Determines valid destination squares depending on the ownership of the pawn, whether the destination square is occupied and if its the pawn's first move.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int representing piece value and ownership through signedness, positive for white, negative for black.
      origin - represents the position of the piece as the index of the square in a RLERF encoded bitboard (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      Returns:
      long representing valid move squares for the supplied piece, ownership, and origin square, in RLERF encoding.

    • generatePawnAttackMask

      public long generatePawnAttackMask(int playerSign, int origin)
      Generates the attack/capture mask of a pawn given its origin square and ownership.

      Determines valid destination squares depending on the ownership of the pawn, whether the destination square is occupied with an enemy piece, and whether an en passent is possible.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int representing piece value and ownership through signedness, positive for white, negative for black.
      origin - represents the position of the piece as the index of the square in a RLERF encoded bitboard (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      Returns:
      long representing valid move squares for the supplied piece, ownership, and origin square, in RLERF encoding.

    • generatePieceVision

      public long generatePieceVision(int playerSign)
      Generates a bitmask representing the provided player's pieces' vision.

      Similar to generatePieceAttackMask but with cut down logic. Scans the calling Board object's boardState attribute for pieces belonging to the player, and generates their vision using the corresponding sliding and non-sliding piece mask generators. This vision mask undergoes bitwise OR with the return value, and after scanning the board the accumulated return value is returned.

      Uses the basic rays and move masks without occupancy checking or king move vision checking since:

      • King cannot move/capture into friendly piece/enemy piece in vision
      • King cannot castle if any piece exists in castling path
      • Vision checking: King is not actually moving, just preventing enemy king from moving

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int representing piece value and ownership through signedness, positive for white, negative for black.
      Returns:
      long representing the player's piece vision, in RLERF encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board).

    • generateEvasionPath

      public static long generateEvasionPath(int origin, int destination)
      Generates a bitmask representing a straight ray between two squares on the chess board.

      Determines what type of ray based on provided origin and destination, then "builds" a ray by setting each bit and incrementing the index according to the ray direction until it reaches the destination, which is not set.

      Parameters:
      origin - represents the origin square of the ray as the index of the square in a RLERF encoded bitboard (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      destination - represents the destination square of the ray as the index of the square in a RLERF encoded bitboard.
      Returns:
      long value representing the isolated raymask, including the origin square but not the destination square, in RLERF format.

    • generateEnPassentMask

      public long generateEnPassentMask(int playerSign, int origin)
      Generates a bitmask representing possible en-passent attacks for the given player and pawn square.

      Mask is generated by checking each possible pawn attack square for the provided origin square for an enemy pawn that had just moved last turn two squares forward.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player owning the pawn, positive for white, negative for black
      origin - represents the position of the piece as the index of the square in a RLERF encoded bitboard (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      Returns:
      long value representing a bit mask of available en passent moves, in RLERF format. Returns 0 if there are no eligble en passent moves

    • generateCheckEvasionMoves

      public ArrayList<int[]> generateCheckEvasionMoves(int playerSign)
      Generates all possible check evasion moves including king moves, piece blocking, and piece capture
      of the checking piece.

      First determines whether it is a single check or more than a single check. If only one check then the
      moves list for all pieces are returned. Otherwise only king moves are returned as king moves are the
      only way to escape double/triple(rare) checks. Possible king moves are generated using generatePieceAttackMask(int,int)
      which already invalidates king moves into enemy vision. Piece check evasion moves are filtered by generating all
      possible moves for each piece, and selecting the moves whose destination square lies on the 'checking path'
      between the checking piece and the king, or the square on which the single checking piece resides. Finally
      the moves that result in a self-check through discovered check are removed from the returned move lists.

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}. This information is then later used to create a Move object.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player owning the pawn, positive for white, negative for black.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<int[]> containing the information for each valid check evasion move.

    • getOpponentChecks

      public ArrayList<int[]> getOpponentChecks(int playerSign)
      Generates an ArrayList of current checks for the provided player's opponent using the boardState
      of the calling Board object.

      The returned moves aren't actually valid moves, they just denote which piece(s) are currently
      checking the provided player's king. This is done by isolating the player's king position and
      iterating through the associated board to search for opponents pieces whose attack path includes the
      king's position, resulting in a check. Self-check filtering is not required here as the moves can't
      actually be "played" on the board.

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}. This information is used to describe all current checks on the player by
      their opponent.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player being checked, whose opponents checking moves
      are returned in this method.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<int[]> containing all current opponent checking moves (effectively checks).

    • generateValidMoves

      public ArrayList<int[]> generateValidMoves(int playerSign)
      Generates an ArrayList of int[] containing all valid moves for the associated Board
      object, for the given player.

      This is the final validator for possible moves on a given board for a given player. Accounts for self-checking
      moves, forced check evasion moves, and valid castling moves. Returns a zero length ArrayList when no moves are
      possible, indicating either checkmate or stalemate. These conditions are accounted for in evaluateGameEndConditions(java.util.ArrayList<int[]>).

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player whose valid moves are being generated. Positive for white
      and negative for black.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<int[]> containing all valid moves for the given player and associated Board object. Returns
      a zero length array in the case of checkmate or stalemate.

    • generateValidCastlingMoves

      public ArrayList<int[]> generateValidCastlingMoves(int playerSign)
      Generates an ArrayList of int[] representing valid castling moves on the associated Board
      object for the given player.

      Basic king move patterns for long and short castles are defined as masks in Board. This method
      simply checks king position, castling rights, and enemy vision to determine whether these are valid for the
      current board position for the given player. If the king is not in the right spot, the castling right doesn't
      exist, or if enemy vision crosses the castling path, then that specific castling move is invalid and not
      included in the return value.

      Castling rights are stored as boolean attributes in Board and maintained elsewhere in updateState(int)

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}. This information is used to describe all current checks on the player by
      their opponent.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player that castling moves are generated for, positive for white,
      negative for black.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList<int[]> array containing all valid castling moves for the given player on the associated board.

    • createMove

      public Move createMove(int[] move)
      Generates a valid Move object given the move information stored in the provided int[].

      Utilizes the ArrayList<int[]> move lists generated by generateValidMoves(int) to create a valid Move object
      Determines the Move type (see ) of the move by checking the associated Board object for destination
      square occupancy and the last played move.

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}. This information is then later used to create a Move object.

      Parameters:
      move - int[] containing the {piece, origin, destination} of the move.
      Returns:
      Fully qualified Move object ready to be 'played' on the board

    • longToString

      public static String longToString(long num)
      Converts a provided primitve long to a 64 length string representing the bit pattern of an int64.

      First character of string represents the MSB, and last character represents the LSB.

      Parameters:
      num - primitive long to be converted to a string representation.
      Returns:
      a 64-length String representing the 64 bit pattern of the provided long as an int64.

    • boardToBitboard

      public static long boardToBitboard(int[][] board)
      Converts a provided int[][] board array to a primitive long bitboard occupancy representation.

      Iterates through the board in RLERF order (see RLERF encoding in Board) and sets the associated bit in the long
      to 1 if a piece exists on that square, 0 otherwise.

      Parameters:
      board - an int[][] representing a boardState, containing values -6 to 6 representing pieces.
      Returns:
      a primitive long representing the occupancy mask/bitboard of the provided board.

      Returns:
      int[][] representing a chess board with all pieces in their starting positions.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      a deep cloned int[][] copy of the provided board.

    • bitboardVisualize

      public static void bitboardVisualize(long bitboard)
      Prints a visual represntation of a bitboard to System.out in proper orientation.

      Proper orientation is a1 at the bottom left, and h8 at the top right. Prints to System.out. Mainly
      used for testing and debugging, but System.out can be redirected if needed for logging, etc.

      Parameters:
      bitboard - primitive long representing a bitboard/occupancy mask to be printed to System.out.

    • boardVisualize

      public static void boardVisualize(int[][] board)
      Prints a visual representation of a board to System.out using UTF-8 chess emojis to symbolize pieces,
      chess board squares, and file and rank labels.

      Utilizes UTF chess emoji codes in CHESS_EMOJI. Prints properly to IDE consoles but native
      windows terminal does not support these codes. For IDE consoles may have to set the active code page by
      executing 'chcp 65001' for UTF-8 (on windows).

      Parameters:
      board - the int[][] board to be visualized and printed to System.out

    • boardVisualize

      public void boardVisualize()
      A non-static version of boardVisualize(int[][]). Prints a visual representation of the
      associated boardState to System.out using UTF-8 chess emojis to symbolize pieces, chess board
      squares, and file and rank labels.

      Utilizes UTF chess emoji codes in CHESS_EMOJI. Prints properly to IDE consoles but native
      windows terminal does not support these codes. For IDE consoles may have to set the active code page by
      executing 'chcp 65001' for UTF-8 (on windows).

    • removeSelfCheckingMoves

      public ArrayList<int[]> removeSelfCheckingMoves(int playerSign, ArrayList<int[]> movesArray)
      Filters out the self-checking moves in the provided ArrayList of int[], returns all remaining
      valid non self-checking moves.

      First deep clones the associated calling Board object's boardState attribute. Then
      'plays' the candidate move on that cloned board. An occupancy mask is then generated from this 'played' board.
      A 'fresh' Board object is created, and its boardState and bitState attributes
      are replaced with the 'played' cloned ones. We then invoke getOpponentChecks(int) on this new board to
      detect whether the candidate move would result in a self check. If the returned list is lenghth zero, we
      know there are no checks and we add the move to the return list. If the returned list is not empty the move
      is discarded.

      As we are only filtering for CHECKS, only the boardState and bitState need to be set on the fresh board.

      The format of the returned ArrayList<int[]> is that each entry in the ArrayList is a separate move described by the
      contained int[]{piece, origin, destination}.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents the player that we are filtering moves for. Moves resulting
      in checks on this player are invalidated.
      movesArray - ArrayList<int[]> of candidate moves to be filtered for self-checking moves.
      Returns:
      ArrayList<int[]> containing all moves that do not result in self-check.

    • findKingBitPosition

      public int findKingBitPosition(int playerSign)
      Returns the position of the specified player's king on the associated Board object, in the form of an index
      of the corresponding bit in the RLERF encoded (see RLERF encoding in Board) bitboard representation.

      Iterates through the associated boardState looking for the value 6 for white, or -6 for black.
      when found the method returns (rowIndex * 8) + fileIndex, which corresponds to the index of the square in
      the RLERF encoding of the board.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign denotes which player's king to locate.
      Returns:
      int denoting the position of the king in the form of an index of the RLERF Board encoded board
      representation.

    • getPlayerEPMask

      public long getPlayerEPMask(int playerSign)
      Generates a long RLERF board representation with any available en passent destination squares.

      Differentiated from generateEnPassentMask(int,int) in that this method looks for all possible
      en passent moves on all squares for the given player. Returned value will always be either zero
      if no en passent is possible, or a single bit flipped indicating the possible en passent. There
      can only ever be one en passent possible for either player.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign denotes which player's en passent moves are being generated.
      Returns:
      long representing a bitmask of any en passent moves available for the provided player,
      in RLERF format (see RLERF encoding in Board). Will only ever be 0 or have a single bit flipped.

    • generateZobristTable

      public static Map<Integer,long[]> generateZobristTable()
      Generates a Map mapping each of the 12 piece values to a primitive long[64], whose contents
      represents a unique zobrist hash value for each chess board square for that specific piece.

      Uses ThreadLocalRandom to generate the random values. The same piece with different owners counts
      as two unique pieces.

      Returns:
      a 12 length Map<Integer, long[64]> representing a unique hash value for each board square,
      for each piece. The order of the long[64] corresponds to the indices of a RLERF encoded board (see RLERF encoding in Board).

    • generateEPHashTable

      public static Map<Integer,Long> generateEPHashTable()
      Generates an 8 length Map mapping each of the 8 possible EP destination files to a
      unique zobrist hash value.
      Returns:
      Map<Integer, Long> mapping each file index Integer to a unique Long zobrist hash value.

    • generateCurrentZobristHash

      public long generateCurrentZobristHash()
      Generates a zobrist hash using the Board attributes representing variables determining a unique position (Piece position, turn, en passent, caslting rights).

      Creates the hash by only 'adding' hashes that of states that are currently true, as if they turn
      false during the course of the game (ie castling) they would be removed at that time anyway from
      the zobrist hash anyway.

      Returns:
      long value representing the zobrist hash of the current state of the current Board.

    • updateZobrist

      public void updateZobrist()
      Updates the current zobrist hash based on the last played move.

      The moving piece is always removed from the origin square and the destination square behaviour depends
      on the type of move. 'Adding' or 'Removing' are done by XOR operations on the precomputed zobrist hashes
      for each piece/square combination.

      This method is always called after updateState(int) and also updates the zobrist hash
      with castling rights, en passent rights, and turn. Finally this zobrist is added to zobristHistory

      Note about castling rights: this method uses separate flags (WSF, WLF, BSF, BLF)
      that are maintained in updateState(int) (which iteslf uses setShortCastleRights(int,boolean) and
      setLongCastleRights(int,boolean) to do so) to indicate whether the castling hash must be XOR'ed out of
      the zobrist hash.
      This is necessary as simply checking if castling == false, would cause repeated adding and removing of the castling
      hash.
      ie. setting whiteShort = false can be done repeatedly and it is still false, however zobristHash ^= whiteShortHash
      repeatedly will not result in the same behaviour. Thus we need a flag that denotes the first time a castling right is set to false,
      at which point this method will XOR out the corresponding castling hash once and only once, as castling rights never come back in a game.

      See Also:
      • updateState(int)
      • zobristHistory

    • checkInsufficientMaterial

      public boolean checkInsufficientMaterial()
      Checks current object for insufficent material on both sides.

      Insufficient material is defined as:

      1. King vs King
      2. King + Knight vs King
      3. King + Bishop vs King
      4. King + Bishop vs King + Bishop
      5. King + Bishop vs King + Knight

      Programatically this is achieved by checking the presence of any Queens, Rooks, or Pawns first. If
      none are present, we determine if material for both sides is less than or equal to 9 (KB vs KB). Now the
      only sufficient material that is 9 pts or lower for both sides would be King+Knight vs King+Knight so if
      both players still have a knight then it is NOT insufficent, otherwise it is.

      Returns:
      true if there is insuffient material, false otherwise.

    • updateHalfClock

      public void updateHalfClock()
      Updates the current halfclock depending on the move that was just played on the current object.

      Increments halfClock by one if the last played move was a non-pawn and non-capture move.
      Otherwise resets the halfclock to zero.

    • checkNMoveDraw

      public boolean checkNMoveDraw(int n)
      Checks whether the current half clock has reached the provided value.

      Used for determining 50 move and 75 move rule trigger point.

      Parameters:
      n - the half clock value at which this method will return true.
      Returns:
      true if halfClock is greater than or equal to n, false otherwise

    • checkNFoldRepeat

      public boolean checkNFoldRepeat(int n)
      Determines if the most recent zobrist hash has occured n or more times in the zobrist history,
      including the most recent occurence.

      Used for determining the 3-fold and 5-fold repeat rule trigger point.

      Parameters:
      n - the number of occurences at which this method will return true.
      Returns:
      true if there are more than or equal to n occurences in the zobrist history, false otherwise.

    • squareIsOccupied

      public boolean squareIsOccupied(int squareBit)

    • hypQuint

      public static long hypQuint(long occMask, long rayMask, long pieceMask)
      Calculate the blocked ray mask from the provided ray blocked by pieces in the provdied
      occupancy mask.

      Uses Hyperbolic quintessence method to generate a blocked ray mask based on the provided
      ray mask and occupancy mask. Essentially leverages bit underflow to unset all indices after
      a blocker piece in the occupancy mask. The masks are then reversed to block the other
      side of the ray since underflow only works in one direction.

      Formatting considerations: The parameters are provided as RLERF encoded masks (see RLERF encoding in Board). However the hyperbolic
      quintessence method utilises LERF (non-reversed) encoding so the provided parameters must first
      be reversed RLERF -> LERF, and the return value reversed from LERF -> RLERF.

      Parameters:
      occMask - mask representing board occupancy in RLERF encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board).
      rayMask - mask representing the specific ray to be blocked in RLERF encoding.
      pieceMask - mask representing the location of the piece that lies on the ray,
      in RLERF encoding. Should only have one set bit representing location.
      Returns:
      mask representing the resulting blocked ray, in RLERF format.

    • getSetBitPositions

      public static ArrayList<Integer> getSetBitPositions(long bitboard)
      Examines the provided long value as an int64 and returns a list containing all of the indices of
      bits that are set to 1.

      Uses Long.numberOfTrailingZeros(long) to count the zeroes from LSB -> MSB (left to right). That number
      would also be the LERF index of the first set bit from LSB -> MSB. We subtract this index from 63 to convert
      to a RLERF index (see RLERF encoding in Board), then add to the return array. We then unset this counted bit by subtracting 1 from it and
      and perfoming an AND with the original board, eliminating the bits that were set with the subtract 1 operation.
      This process is then repeated until there are no more set bits in the bitboard.

      bitboard --> 0b0010 1000
      bitboard - 1 --> 0b0010 0111
      bitboard &= bitboard - 1 --> 0b0010 0000

      Parameters:
      bitboard - long representation of a RLERF (see ) encoded bitboard.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Integer representing all indicices in the provided bitboard that were
      set.

    • shift

      public static long shift(long pos, int direction)
      Utility method used in generateEvasionPath(int,int) that shifts the provided pos bitmask in the direction
      specified by the provided direction, and returns the result.
      Parameters:
      pos - long RLERF bitmask (see ) with one flipped bit as the current 'position' to be shifted.
      direction - int representing the index shift required to shift the position in a specific direction in RLERF
      encoding (see RLERF encoding in Board). ie 'up' is +8, 'down' is -8, 'up-right' would be +9, etc.
      Returns:
      long RLERF bitmask (see ) representing the original pos mask shifted by the provided direction.

    • setShortCastleRights

      public void setShortCastleRights(int playerSign, boolean bool)
      Mutator method used to set short castling rights for either player.

      When invoked sets the short castling right for the provided player to the provided state
      on the current object. Additionally flips the zobrist associated flags WSF and BSF
      when the castling value changes from true to false or vice versa, so updateZobrist() can
      update the castling hash only when the castling rights change values.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents which players castling rights to change, positive for white
      and negative for black.
      bool - the value to change the castling right to.

      on the current object. Additionally flips the zobrist associated flags WLF and BLF
      when the castling value changes from true to false or vice versa, so updateZobrist() can
      update the castling hash only when the castling rights change values.

      Parameters:
      playerSign - int whose sign represents which players castling rights to change, positive for white
      and negative for black.
      bool - the value to change the castling right to.

    • playMove

      public void playMove(Move mv)
      Method responsible for playing a Move on to the current Board.

      Reads the move and changes boardState according to the move information. Also modifies bitState
      according to the changes made by the move. Then adds the played move to playedMoves. Finally sets lastBoardState
      to a deep clone of the board before the move was played.

      Proper game loop order:
      Depending on user input mode this may vary slightly, but the following describes the order required
      for moves to be played and the board to update its state accordingly. Move selection/validation require
      separate methods.

      1. playMove(engine.Move) to play the move on to the board
      2. updateState(int) to update the state based on the move just played, flips turn
      3. generateValidMoves(int) to generate moves for the next player
      4. evaluateGameEndConditions(java.util.ArrayList<int[]>) determines any forcing game-end states based on the current object
        and the provided valid moves array.

      Parameters:
      mv - the Move to be played on to the current Board.

    • updateState

      public void updateState(int lastPlayerSign)
      Updates the state of the current Board to reflect changes caused by the most recently played Move.

      Determines board state by generating opponent checks for opposing player. If no checks then game is
      Board.BOARD_STATE.IN_PLAY, otherwise game is in Board.BOARD_STATE.CHECK. Also updates halfClock
      , zobristHash, threeFoldDrawAvailable, and fiftyMoveDrawAvailable.

      Updates castling rights based on last move:

      1. If king moves both of that player's castling rights are invalidated
      2. If either rook moves from its starting position, that side's castling is invalidated

      Both castling flags as well as flags used to inform updateZobrist() about the first time castling rights have changed are
      maintained here.
      These separate flags are necessary as updateZobrist() only removes the castling hash from the zobrist hash the first time
      any of the castling rights are set to false.

      Finally flips depending on whose turn it is.

      Proper game loop order:
      Depending on user input mode this may vary slightly, but the following describes the order required
      for moves to be played and the board to update its state accordingly. Move selection/validation require
      separate methods.

      1. playMove(engine.Move) to play the move on to the board
      2. updateState(int) to update the state based on the move just played, flips turn
      3. generateValidMoves(int) to generate moves for the next player
      4. evaluateGameEndConditions(java.util.ArrayList<int[]>) determines any forcing game-end states based on the current object
        and the provided valid moves array.

      Parameters:
      lastPlayerSign - int whose sign represents the player that played the last move. Positive for white negative for black.

    • evaluateGameEndConditions

      public int evaluateGameEndConditions(ArrayList<int[]> validMoves)
      Determines if the current object has reached a forced game end state.

      Determines checkmate vs stalemate by examining the length of the provided validMoves array
      generated by generateValidMoves(int). If there are valid moves, then goes on to check
      for forced draw conditions on the current object such as insufficient material, 5-fold repeat
      draw, and 75-move rule draw.

      Proper game loop order:
      Depending on user input mode this may vary slightly, but the following describes the order required
      for moves to be played and the board to update its state accordingly. Move selection/validation require
      separate methods.

      1. playMove(engine.Move) to play the move on to the board
      2. updateState(int) to update the state based on the move just played, flips turn
      3. generateValidMoves(int) to generate moves for the next player
      4. evaluateGameEndConditions(java.util.ArrayList<int[]>) determines any forcing game-end states based on the current object
        and the provided valid moves array.

      Parameters:
      validMoves - an ArrayList of valid moves generated by generateValidMoves(int).
      Returns:
      return values depending on game-end states of the current object:
      1. 0 = No game end condition, game continues
      2. 1 = Checkmate
      3. 2 = Stalemate draw
      4. 3 = Insufficient material draw
      5. 4 = 75 move rule draw
      6. 5 = 5-fold repeat draw

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
